locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explains the eschatological judgment of Christ the King, contrasting the 'old Adam' with life 'in Christ' and refuting modern skepticism (Robert Hughes).
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. It connects the Matthean judgment scene with Pauline anthropology and Ezekiel's shepherd imagery.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the reality of future judgment and the nature of the church, with a late shift toward promising grace.
voorbeelden: Jesus Christ will be the Judge, and no one else.
The division between bad people and good people is actually a division that runs through each of us.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Awe, humility, and a sense of security in Christ's righteousness rather than one's own deeds.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Yes, explicitly mentions the 'indwelling Spirit' in the conclusion.

voorbeelden: We are poised between the human past and the divine future.
The Christian faith is not founded on anyone’s personal... experiences.
Adam is Paul’s name for you and me.
Let us pause for a moment...
Don’t be sidetracked by literal-minded speculations.
I was thrilled to be reminded of this saying.
I think of a woman I know...
He has compensated for our too-short list of good deeds.
By his indwelling Spirit he will make us into those who will some day hear...
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong but concentrated almost entirely in the final two paragraphs.

voorbeelden: I tell you... you have done it unto me (quoting Jesus).
We will be refashioned in the image of him.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the Creed and the Biblical text to declare a new reality for the hearer.

indicatoren: Extensive use of third-person descriptions of the judgment scene.
Lengthy refutation of Robert Hughes (talking about skepticism).
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a future event rather than a participant in a present encounter.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' of the sermon is delayed until the very end.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological quality, but low frequency.
voorbeelden: He has compensated for our too-short list of good deeds by his one great deed.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation, especially regarding the Pledge and the 'old Adam'.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to convict ('poor specimens as you and me') and then to promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominates the exegesis of Matthew and the critique of Robert Hughes.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere for the first 60% of the text.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions and descriptions of the church.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the sermon and the future 'now' of judgment.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the Assertive (Judgment is coming) to the Declarative (You are in Adam/Christ) to the Commissive (He has saved you).
voorbeelden: The division... runs through each of us (Assertive) -> He has compensated for our deeds (Commissive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is sound but the 'Assertive' phase is disproportionately long.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: If you believe... then you will 'rejoice and be glad' to offer up some of your substance.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: Despite a heavy constative start, the sermon successfully pivots to a performative conclusion that redefines the hearer's identity in Christ.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The division between bad people and good people is actually a division that runs through each of us.

zwakke_punten.probleem: Spends too much time 'talking about' skepticism rather than 'proclaiming to' the hearer.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final third when the 'Judge judged in our place' is proclaimed directly to the 'poor specimens'.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of the 'Judge judged in our place' is a classic performative reversal.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the preacher's use of 'The Lord says' and the final blessing.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the section on the Creed and the Pledge.
tekstueel_bewijs: The church exists... to say the creed.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, 'by his indwelling Spirit he will make us'.
tekstueel_bewijs: Now by his indwelling Spirit he will make us into those...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon acts as a means of 'covering our unrighteousness'.
tekstueel_bewijs: covering our unrighteousness with his righteousness

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'is' and 'says' (3rd person) to 'gives' and 'promises' (2nd person) earlier in the text.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus Christ will be the Judge, and no one else.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, this Jesus stands before you as your Judge, but also as your Savior.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a factual statement about the future to a present-tense encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried at the very end.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interweave the promise of Christ's righteousness into the description of the judgment scene.
voorbeeldzinnen: Even as you stand before this throne, Christ clothes you in his own merit.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' to place the hearer directly in the sheep/goat divide earlier.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the one being divided; you are the one being called.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A robust theological sermon that successfully avoids moralism through a powerful performative finish.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the preacher isn't just sending a 'message' about judgment, but is the instrument through which the Judge speaks 'Come, O blessed' to the hearer now.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power is not in the 'Robert Hughes' anecdote (rhetoric), but in the commissive 'He has compensated for our deeds' (SAT).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'event-character' is concentrated in the final 200 words where the illocutionary force shifts from Assertive to Commissive.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The Judge judged in our place.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: This is the 'sacramental pivot' of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Theological Proclamation' that risks being a 'Lecture' until the final movement.
